page.title: 04The M40 in block 04280258
page.content: The proposed M40 will cut through the north east corner of our block, with half of a split interchange being constructed where the motorway crosses the A41. Southbound traffic will be able to join the motorway from the A41 and Northbound traffic will be able to exit the motorway. By 2004 it is expected that between 45 000 and 53 000 vehicles a day will be using it, 80% being cars and the rest commercial vehicles. This section will cost Â£2m per kilometre to construct and will include bridges over the motorway for Hareway lane, the A41, Oakleywood road and the farm acess to Wiggerland Wood Farm. No properties will be destroyed in its construction. It will have a serious effect on the A41, which will be detrunked as 80% of its traffic transfers to the M40
